name: Artix Linux
description: Artix Linux is a systemd-free Arch-based Linux distribution that uses alternative init systems such as OpenRC, runit, s6, and dinit. It appeals to users who want full control over their init system.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: Artix was created as a continuation of the Arch-OpenRC project after Arch dropped support for non-systemd init systems in 2017.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: Artix grew quickly as the go-to Arch-based system for users who prefer alternatives to systemd. It supports multiple init systems and offers several desktop editions.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: Artix remains an active and popular systemd-free alternative to Arch. It has strong community support and frequent updates via Arch's rolling release model.

sections.title: Init System Diversity
